pageContext.description: Socket diameter 28mm. A perfect specimen. Single lateral loop linking base of blade to socket. Hollow-winged blade.
pageContext.patina: Dull green patina, mottled in places with patches of rich green corrosion on shaft near loop.
pageContext.publications: "Buxton Advertizer", 6th September 1930: reprinted Journ. Brit. Archaeol. Assoc. N.S. XXXVI.ii (June 1931), pp. 400-401, Fig. (site omitted), with photograph.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,W. Allan Milton,Carlton Holm, Robertson Road, Buxton (1930)
pageContext.site: England,Derbyshire,Buxton (near),Found "in a small crevice of the Limestone face" on property of the Buxton Lime Firms, Sept. 1930.
pageContext.remarks: One loop only/like that of a celt), no trace of those having been another.
